0.title: Controlled substances; include synthetic cannabinoids.
0.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Various Synthetic Cannabinoids In Schedule I; And For Related Purposes.

1.title: Desoto County; authorize to construct county jail anywhere in the county.
1.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Construct A New County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

2.title: City of D'Iberville; authorize to acquire and lease certain real property for economic and commercial development purposes.
2.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of D'iberville, Mississippi, To Acquire Certain Real Property; To Authorize The City To Enter Into A Financing Agreement With The Seller Or Sellers For Such Real Property; To Authorize The Governing Authorities To Lease Property, Once Acquired And Already Owned By The City, For Terms Varying In Length, But Not To Exceed 99 Years, Thereby Resulting In The Purchase Of The Property At The Conclusion Of The Term Or Terms Of The Lease For Economic And Commercial Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

6.title: Economic development; create the MS Development Authority Workforce Training Fund, increase bonds for certain industry incentives.
6.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Development Authority Workforce Training Fund To Provide Workforce Training Through State Institutions Of Higher Learning, Community And Junior Colleges, And Workforce Investment Network Job Centers To Meet Workforce Training Needs Not Met By Other Resources; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $4,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Development Authority Workforce Training Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $1,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For Performing Research On Biomass Usage In The Production Of Renewable Crude Oil At The Sustainable Energy Research Center At Mississippi State University; To Amend Section 25, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, To Increase By $45,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Component Materials Used In The Construction Of A Building, Or Any Addition Or Improvement Thereon, And Sales Or Leases Of Machinery And Equipment Not Later Than Three Months After The Completion Of The Construction Of The Facility, To Be Used In The Facility, To Certain Permanent Business Enterprises Operating A Facility Producing Renewable Crude Oil From Biomass Harvested Or Produced In Whole Or In Part In Mississippi; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Money In The Housing Development Revolving Loan Fund Shall Be Transferred To The Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund And To Repeal The Housing Development Revolving Loan Fund From And After The Date The Transfer Is Completed; To Repeal Section 21-37-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Certain Procedures To Be Followed By Municipalities In Order To Establish, Construct And Operate A Municipal Parking Facility For Motor Vehicles Of Members Of The General Public; And For Related Purposes.

8.title: Tupelo Community Theatre; commend and congratulate on its 40th year anniversary.
8.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Tupelo Community Theatre On The Occasion Of Its 40th Anniversary Celebration, Commemorating A Rich Legacy Of Artistic And Thespian Culture, Preservation, Education And Theatrical Appreciation.

9.title: Outer continental shelf revenue sharing; urge Congress to pass legislation accelerating timetable providing for.
9.description: A Resolution Urging The United States Congress To Pass Legislation Accelerating The Timetable For Outer Continental Shelf Revenue Sharing.

10.title: Mrs. Josephine Neal Gray; commend life and legacy upon her passing.
10.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy And Service Of Mrs. Josephine Neal Gray And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

11.title: Percy Miller; commend for raising awareness of healthy initiatives, youth education and positive decision-making in the MS Delta.
11.description: A Resolution Commending Percy "master P" Miller For Raising Awareness Of Healthy Initiatives, Youth Education And Positive Decision-making In The Mississippi Delta In Collaboration With The Urban Born Organization And First Lady Michelle Obama's "let's Move" Campaign.

12.title: Mary Katherine Patterson; commend life and legacy upon her passing.
12.description: A Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Service Of Kosciusko Native And Retired Upstanding Business Woman, Mrs. Mary Katherine Patterson, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

13.title: Bless our Schools Sunday - a Day of Prayer for Children and Schools in Mississippi; designate September 19, 2010, as.
13.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Vital Asset The State Of Mississippi Possesses In The Promise And Future Of Our Children, To Ensure Their Continued Growth, Prosperity, Preservation And Legacies As They Mature Into Successful And Resourceful Contributors To Our Great State And Nation's Society, And To Designate September 19, 2010, As "bless Our Schools Sunday - A Day Of Prayer For Children And Schools In Mississippi."

14.title: Wilson Nathaniel "Nate" Causey; commend and congratulate on the occasion of his 35th birthday.
14.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Wilson Nathaniel "nate" Causey On The Occasion Of His 35th Birthday, And Designating September 9, 2010, As Wilson Nathaniel Causey Day In The State Of Mississippi.

16.title: 2010 Second Extraordinary Session; set sine die adjournment at 6:00 p.m., August 27, 2010.
16.description: A Concurrent Resolution Fixing The Date Of Sine Die Adjournment Of The 2010 Second Extraordinary Session Of The Mississippi Legislature At 6:00 P.m., Friday, August 27, 2010.

19.title: DeSoto County; authorize to construct county jail anywhere in the county.
19.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Construct A New County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

20.title: Synthetic cannabinoids; revise Schedule I to include.
20.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Various Synthetic Cannabinoids In Schedule I; And For Related Purposes.

21.title: City of McComb; authorize to impose a tourism tax to promote tourism and parks and recreation.
21.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Mccomb, Mississippi, To Impose A Tourism Tax Within The City, And To Expend The Proceeds Of The Tax To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

23.title: Commend life of Afghanistan casualty U.S. Army First Sergeant Bobby Barton.
23.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Army First Sergeant Robert "bobby" Nicholas Barton Ii, A Native Mississippian From Roxie, Mississippi, Who Was Lost In Action In Afghanistan On June 7, 2010, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

24.title: Commend life of Iraq casualty U.S. Army Sergeant Anthony Magee.
24.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Army Sergeant Anthony O. Magee Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, Who Died On April 27, 2010, From Wounds Received In Action In Iraq, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

25.title: Commend the life of Afghanistan casualty National Guard Sergeant David Alexander Holmes, Jr.
25.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of Sergeant David Alexander Holmes, Jr., A Native Mississippian From Batesville, Mississippi, Who Died From Wounds Sustained In Action In Afghanistan On June 26, 2010.

26.title: Commend the life of Retired Chief Justice of the Mississippi Supreme Court Dan Lee.
26.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Legacy Of Public Service Of Retired Chief Justice Of The Mississippi Supreme Court Dan M. Lee Of Brandon, Mississippi.

27.title: Commend the life and service of John Ed Ainsworth.
27.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Recognizing The Legacy Of Service Of John Ed Ainsworth.

28.title: Commend the life of Jackson banker, World War II Veteran and community leader Herman Hines.
28.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Jackson Banker, World War Ii Veteran And Community Leader Herman Hines, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

29.title: Commend Dr. Ennis Proctor, Executive Director of the Mississippi High School Activities Association.
29.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending Dr. Ennis Proctor Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As Longtime Executive Director Of The Mississippi High School Activities Association.

30.title: Recognize University of Mississippi Sports program for SEC All-Sports Trophy ranking.
30.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The University Of Mississippi "rebels" Sports Program For Its 2009-2010 High Ranking In The Southeastern Conference (sec) All-sports Trophy.

31.title: Commend life of Afghanistan casualty U.S. Marine Lance Corporal Philip P. Clark.
31.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Marine Lance Corporal Philip P. Clark, A Native Mississippian From Jackson, Who Was Lost In Action In Afghanistan On May 18, 2010, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

32.title: Mourn the loss of Marshall County Deputy Sheriff Lt. Carol Scruggs.
32.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life Of Lt. Carol Jean Hampton Scruggs, Deputy Sheriff For Marshall County, Mississippi, Who Was Lost In The Line Of Duty.

33.title: Commend the life of former Brandon Mayor W.L. Whittington.
33.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life Of Former Brandon Mayor W.l. Whittington.

34.title: Commend Petal High School "Panthers" Baseball Team for 2010 Class 6A State Championship.
34.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Petal High School "panthers" Baseball Team And Head Coach Larry Watkins For Winning The 2010 Mhsaa Class 6a State Championship.

35.title: Commend the life of Mrs. Vashti Underwood Muse, the "First Lady" of Hinds Community College.
35.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Outstanding Educational Service Of Mrs. Vashti Underwood Muse, The "first Lady" Of Hinds Community College.

36.title: Designate September 19, 2010, as "Bless Our Schools Sunday in Mississippi."
36.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating September 19, 2010, As "bless Our Schools Sunday In Mississippi - A Day Of Prayer For Children And Schools."

37.title: Mourn the loss of George County Sheriff Garry M. Welford and express the sympathy of the Legislature.
37.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Dedicated Law Enforcement Service Of George County Sheriff Garry Marshall Welford Who Was Lost In The Line Of Duty And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

38.title: Commend James Arnold, Jr., Chief Financial Officer of Kofax, Inc.
38.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Executive Management Accomplishments Of Delta State University Graduate James Arnold, Jr., Chief Financial Officer And Member Of The Board Of Directors Of Kofax, Inc.

39.title: Mourn the loss of Jackson Police Officer Glen Victor Agee.
39.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Jackson Police Officer Glen Victor Agee Of Collins, Mississippi.

40.title: Recognize the Global Leadership Institute at Jackson Preparatory School.
40.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Global Leadership Institute At Jackson Preparatory School As An Institution That Promotes And Encourages Student Leadership.

41.title: Commend life and military service of U.S. Marine Corps Sgt. William Casey Brown.
41.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Military Service Of United States Marine Corps Veteran Sergeant William Casey Brown Of Southaven, Mississippi, And Extending Sympathy On His Passing.

42.title: Commend public service of Elder James H. Stringer, First Pentecostal Church of Biloxi.
42.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And 50 Years Of Public Service To His Community And To His Church Of Elder James H. Stringer And Designating September 12, 2010, As "elder James H. Stringer Day In Mississippi."

43.title: Commend North Pontotoc High School "Vikings" first-year Archery Team for winning State Championship.
43.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating The North Pontotoc High School "vikings" First-year Archery Team And Head Coach Joe Waller For Winning The State Championship, Their First State Title In Any Sport.

44.title: Commend North Pontotoc High School "Lady Vikings" Fast-Pitch Softball Team for State Championship.
44.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating The 2009-2010 North Pontotoc High School "lady Vikings" Fast-pitch Softball Team And Head Coach Shane Montgomery For Winning The Mhsaa State Championship And For Their Outstanding Season.

45.title: Commend the life of David Poff, former Benton County Justice Court Judge and Ashland Alderman.
45.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Public Service Of David Jerrell Poff, Former Benton County Justice Court Judge And Alderman For The Town Of Ashland.

46.title: Recognize the legacy of Coach William "Bill" Foster and Coach Willie "Rat" McGowan at dedication of ASU baseball field and stadium.
46.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Sports Legacies Of Coach Willie E. "rat" Mcgowan, Sr., And Coach William Hendrick "bill" Foster On The Occasion Of The Dedication Of The Alcorn State University Baseball Stadium And Field Named In Their Honor.

47.title: Designating "Fannie Lou Hamer Day in Mississippi."
47.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Legacy Of Mrs. Fannie Lou Hamer Of Ruleville, Mississippi, And Designating October 6, 2010, As "fannie Lou Hamer Day In Mississippi."
